canonical_explanation.text: There are many animals around us. Some animals live with us and help us. They are called domestic animals, like cow, dog, cat, and hen. Animals that live in forests and jungles are called wild animals, like lion, tiger, and elephant. Animals have different body coverings like fur, feathers, and scales. They make different sounds and live in different homes.
rules: Domestic animals live with us or near us. Examples: cow, dog, cat, hen, goat, horse.
Wild animals live in forests and jungles. Examples: lion, tiger, elephant, deer, monkey.
Pet animals are kept at home for company. Examples: dog, cat, parrot, fish.
Animals have different body coverings: fur (dog, cat), feathers (hen, parrot), scales (fish, snake).
Animals make different sounds: dog barks, cat meows, cow moos, lion roars, hen clucks.
Animals live in different homes: dog in kennel, horse in stable, hen in coop, lion in den, bird in nest.

questions.question_text: Which of these is a domestic animal?
questions.explanation_correct: Cow is a domestic animal. Domestic animals live with or near people. Cows give us milk and are found in homes and farms.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Lion, tiger, and elephant are wild animals that live in forests. Cow is a domestic animal that lives near people and gives us milk.

questions.question_text: Which of these is a wild animal?
questions.explanation_correct: Tiger is a wild animal. Wild animals live in forests and jungles. Tigers are strong and powerful animals found in Indian forests.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Dog, cat, and hen are domestic animals that live near people. Tiger is a wild animal that lives in the forest.

questions.question_text: What sound does a dog make?
questions.explanation_correct: A dog barks. Bark is the sound that dogs make. Dogs bark to communicate, when they are happy, or to alert us.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Moo is the sound a cow makes, meow is from a cat, and roar is from a lion. A dog makes a bark sound.

questions.question_text: What sound does a cat make?
questions.explanation_correct: A cat meows. Meow is the sound that cats make. Cats meow when they are hungry, happy, or want attention.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Bark is from a dog, moo is from a cow, and quack is from a duck. A cat makes a meow sound.

questions.question_text: Which animal has feathers on its body?
questions.explanation_correct: A hen has feathers on its body. All birds, like hens, parrots, and peacocks, have feathers that cover their body.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Dogs have fur, fish have scales, and snakes have scales. Hen is a bird and all birds have feathers on their body.

questions.question_text: Which animal has scales on its body?
questions.explanation_correct: A fish has scales on its body. Scales are small flat pieces that cover the body of fish and protect them in water.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Cat, dog, and cow have fur or hair on their body. Fish have scales that are small shiny flat pieces covering their skin.

questions.question_text: Where does a bird live?
questions.explanation_correct: A bird lives in a nest. Birds build nests using twigs, leaves, and grass on trees or in safe places to lay eggs and raise babies.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A kennel is for a dog, a stable is for a horse, and a pond is where fish live. Birds build and live in nests.

questions.question_text: Where does a dog live?
questions.explanation_correct: A pet dog lives in a kennel. A kennel is a small house built for a dog to rest and sleep in.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Nests are for birds, dens are for lions, and burrows are for rabbits. A dog lives in a kennel.

questions.question_text: Which animal gives us milk?
questions.explanation_correct: Cow gives us milk. In India, cows are very important because they give us milk which we use to make curd, butter, and ghee.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Hens give us eggs, fish live in water, and parrots are birds. Cows are the animals that give us milk.

questions.question_text: Which animal gives us eggs?
questions.explanation_correct: A hen gives us eggs. Hens lay eggs which we cook and eat. Eggs are very healthy food.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Cows give milk, dogs guard our homes, and goats give milk. The hen is the animal that gives us eggs.

questions.question_text: What sound does a cow make?
questions.explanation_correct: A cow moos. Moo is the sound that cows make. You can hear cows mooing in farms and villages.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Bark is from a dog, meow is from a cat, and roar is from a lion. A cow makes a moo sound.

questions.question_text: What sound does a lion make?
questions.explanation_correct: A lion roars. The lion's roar is very loud and strong. The lion is called the king of the jungle because of its powerful roar.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Bark is from a dog, meow is from a cat, and quack is from a duck. A lion makes a loud roar sound.

questions.question_text: Riya saw an animal in the zoo that had black and orange stripes. What animal did she see?
questions.explanation_correct: Riya saw a tiger. Tigers have black stripes on their orange body. Tigers are wild animals found in Indian forests.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Lions do not have stripes, elephants are grey, and deer are brown. The animal with black and orange stripes is a tiger.

questions.question_text: Which animal has fur on its body?
questions.explanation_correct: A dog has fur on its body. Fur is soft hair that covers the body of animals like dogs, cats, and rabbits to keep them warm.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Fish and snakes have scales, and frogs have smooth wet skin. Dogs have fur (soft hair) that covers their body.

questions.question_text: Where does a lion live?
questions.explanation_correct: A lion lives in a den. A den is a cave or hidden place in the forest where wild animals like lions rest and sleep.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A kennel is for a dog, a nest is for a bird, and a stable is for a horse. A lion lives in a den in the forest.

questions.question_text: Which animal can be kept as a pet at home?
questions.explanation_correct: A dog can be kept as a pet at home. Dogs are friendly, loyal, and they love being with people.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Tigers, lions, and crocodiles are wild animals. They are dangerous and cannot be kept as pets. Dogs are safe and friendly pets.

questions.question_text: The national bird of India is the:
questions.explanation_correct: The peacock is the national bird of India. It has beautiful colourful feathers and dances when it rains.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Parrot, crow, and sparrow are common birds but not the national bird. The peacock with its beautiful feathers is the national bird of India.

questions.question_text: Where does a horse live?
questions.explanation_correct: A horse lives in a stable. A stable is a building where horses are kept, fed, and taken care of.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A den is for a lion, a nest is for a bird, and a burrow is for a rabbit. A horse lives in a stable.

questions.question_text: Raj visited a farm. Which animals did he most likely see there?
questions.explanation_correct: On a farm, Raj most likely saw cow, hen, and goat. These are farm or domestic animals that people keep for milk, eggs, and other things.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Lions, tigers, whales, dolphins, penguins, and polar bears are not farm animals. Cows, hens, and goats are common animals found on Indian farms.

questions.question_text: A turtle has a hard covering on its back. This is called a:
questions.explanation_correct: A turtle has a hard shell on its back. The shell protects the turtle from danger. When scared, a turtle hides inside its shell.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Feathers are for birds, fur is for dogs and cats, and scales are for fish. A turtle's hard covering is called a shell.

questions.question_text: Where does a rabbit live?
questions.explanation_correct: A rabbit lives in a burrow. A burrow is a hole dug in the ground where rabbits live and keep their babies safe.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Nests are for birds, kennels are for dogs, and stables are for horses. Rabbits live in burrows which are holes in the ground.

questions.question_text: Which of these animals lives in water?
questions.explanation_correct: Fish live in water. They swim in rivers, ponds, lakes, and seas. Fish breathe in water using their gills.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Dogs, cats, and cows live on land. Fish are the animals that live in water and cannot survive outside water.

questions.question_text: Seema heard 'cock-a-doodle-doo' early in the morning. Which animal made this sound?
questions.explanation_correct: A rooster (cock) crows 'cock-a-doodle-doo' early in the morning. Roosters wake up early and crow when the sun comes up.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Dogs bark, cats meow, and cows moo. The 'cock-a-doodle-doo' sound is made by a rooster (cock) in the early morning.

questions.question_text: Which big animal has a long trunk?
questions.explanation_correct: An elephant has a long trunk. The trunk is used for breathing, drinking water, picking up food, and even spraying water.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Tigers, deer, and horses do not have trunks. The elephant is the big animal with a long trunk.

questions.question_text: Match the animal with its body covering: Snake has:
questions.explanation_correct: A snake has scales on its body. Scales are small flat pieces that cover the snake's body and help it slide smoothly on the ground.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Fur is for animals like dogs and cats, feathers are for birds, and shells are for turtles. Snakes have scales on their body.

questions.question_text: Which of these is NOT a pet animal?
questions.explanation_correct: Tiger is NOT a pet animal. Tigers are wild and dangerous animals that live in forests. Dogs, cats, and parrots can be kept as pets.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Dogs, cats, and parrots are common pet animals. Tiger is a wild animal that cannot be safely kept as a pet.

questions.question_text: Where does a hen live?
questions.explanation_correct: A hen lives in a coop. A coop is a small house made for hens to live in, lay eggs, and stay safe from other animals.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A den is for a lion, a burrow is for a rabbit, and a stable is for a horse. A hen lives in a coop.

questions.question_text: Suresh took his cow to the field to eat grass. The cow is a:
questions.explanation_correct: The cow is a domestic animal. Domestic animals live with or near people. Suresh takes care of his cow and the cow gives milk.
questions.explanation_incorrect: The cow is not a wild, water, or forest animal. Since Suresh keeps the cow near his home and takes care of it, it is a domestic animal.

questions.question_text: Kavya saw an animal that had colourful feathers and could talk. Which pet animal was it?
questions.explanation_correct: Kavya saw a parrot. Parrots have colourful feathers and some parrots can repeat words that people say. They are popular pet birds in India.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Dogs have fur, cats have fur, and fish have scales. The pet with colourful feathers that can talk is a parrot.

questions.question_text: Which animal do people ride on?
questions.explanation_correct: People ride on horses. Horses are strong domestic animals used for riding, carrying loads, and in races.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Hens, cats, and dogs are too small to ride. Horses are big, strong animals that people ride on.

questions.question_text: A cow is a domestic animal.
questions.explanation_correct: Yes, a cow is a domestic animal. Cows live near people, on farms, and give us milk.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is true. A cow is a domestic animal. It lives near humans and gives us milk, which is very useful.

questions.question_text: A lion lives in our house.
questions.explanation_correct: This is false. A lion does not live in our house. A lion is a wild animal that lives in forests and jungles.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Lions do not live in houses. They are wild animals that live in forests, jungles, and wildlife sanctuaries.

questions.question_text: Birds have feathers on their body.
questions.explanation_correct: Yes, birds have feathers on their body. Feathers help birds fly and keep them warm.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is true. All birds have feathers. Feathers help birds fly and protect them from cold and heat.

questions.question_text: A fish has fur on its body.
questions.explanation_correct: This is false. A fish does not have fur. A fish has scales on its body that help it swim in water.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Fish do not have fur. Fish have scales on their body. Fur is found on animals like dogs, cats, and rabbits.

questions.question_text: A bird lives in a nest.
questions.explanation_correct: Yes, a bird lives in a nest. Birds build nests on trees using twigs, leaves, and grass.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is true. Birds build nests on trees or in safe spots. The nest is the bird's home where it lives and lays eggs.

questions.question_text: A dog is a wild animal.
questions.explanation_correct: This is false. A dog is a domestic or pet animal, not a wild animal. Dogs live with people and are very friendly.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Dogs are not wild animals. Dogs are domestic animals and popular pets. They live with people and are loyal and friendly.

questions.question_text: A cat barks.
questions.explanation_correct: This is false. A cat does not bark. A cat meows. Dogs are the animals that bark.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Cats do not bark. Cats meow. Barking is the sound that dogs make, not cats.

questions.question_text: Which group has only wild animals?
questions.explanation_correct: Lion, tiger, and deer are all wild animals. They live in forests and are not kept at home.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Dog, cow, hen, cat, parrot, fish, horse, goat, and buffalo are all domestic or pet animals. Only lion, tiger, and deer are all wild animals.

questions.question_text: Which group has only animals with fur?
questions.explanation_correct: Dog, cat, and rabbit all have fur on their body. Fur is soft hair that covers their body and keeps them warm.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Fish, snake, and frog do not have fur. Hen, parrot, and peacock have feathers. Turtle and snail have shells. Only dog, cat, and rabbit all have fur.

questions.question_text: A spider builds a:
questions.explanation_correct: A spider builds a web. Spiders spin silk threads to make a web. They use the web to catch insects for food.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Nests are for birds, burrows are for rabbits, and dens are for lions. A spider builds a web from silk threads.

questions.question_text: Which animal gives us wool?
questions.explanation_correct: Sheep give us wool. Wool is the soft, warm hair of sheep. We use wool to make sweaters and blankets.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Cows give milk, hens give eggs, and dogs guard our homes. Sheep give us wool which keeps us warm in winter.

questions.question_text: Which of these animals is the biggest?
questions.explanation_correct: The elephant is the biggest animal among these. Elephants are very large and strong animals.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Cats, rabbits, and hens are much smaller animals. The elephant is the biggest animal in this list.

questions.question_text: Amit heard 'quack quack' near a pond. Which animal made this sound?
questions.explanation_correct: A duck makes the 'quack quack' sound. Ducks are birds that can swim in water and are often found near ponds and lakes.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Frogs croak, fish do not make sounds we can hear, and snakes hiss. The 'quack quack' sound is made by a duck.

questions.question_text: Match the animal with its home: Horse lives in a ___.
questions.explanation_correct: A horse lives in a stable. A stable is a building where horses are kept, fed, and looked after.
questions.explanation_incorrect: A kennel is for a dog, a nest is for a bird, and a coop is for a hen. A horse lives in a stable.

questions.question_text: Buffalo gives us:
questions.explanation_correct: Buffalo gives us milk. In India, buffalo milk is used to make paneer, curd, butter, and ghee.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Eggs come from hens, wool from sheep, and honey from bees. Buffalo gives us milk, just like cows.

questions.question_text: The peacock is the national bird of India.
questions.explanation_correct: Yes, the peacock is the national bird of India. It has beautiful colourful feathers and is found across India.
questions.explanation_incorrect: This is true. The peacock (mor) is India's national bird. It has a beautiful tail with blue and green feathers.

questions.question_text: Which animal helps farmers plough their fields in villages?
questions.explanation_correct: A bull or ox helps farmers plough their fields. In Indian villages, bulls are used to pull the plough and prepare fields for planting crops.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Dogs, cats, and parrots do not plough fields. Bulls (oxen) are strong domestic animals used by farmers to plough fields in Indian villages.

questions.question_text: A fish lives in a nest.
questions.explanation_correct: This is false. A fish does not live in a nest. A fish lives in water, in rivers, ponds, lakes, or the sea.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Fish do not live in nests. Nests are for birds. Fish live in water such as rivers, ponds, and seas.

questions.question_text: Which of these animals does NOT have legs?
questions.explanation_correct: A snake does not have legs. Snakes move by sliding their body on the ground. They have scales and no legs at all.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Dogs, cats, and hens all have legs. A snake is the animal that does not have any legs. It crawls and slides to move.

questions.question_text: Goats, cows, and buffaloes all give us:
questions.explanation_correct: Goats, cows, and buffaloes all give us milk. In India, we get milk from these animals. Milk is used to make many dairy products.
questions.explanation_incorrect: Eggs come from hens, honey from bees, and silk from silkworms. Goats, cows, and buffaloes are all animals that give us milk.
